alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 4:50PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Plateau Creek near Cameo affecting Mesa County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Plateau Creek near Cameo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Water will approach homes in the low-lying areas adjacent to Plateau Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM MDT Friday, May 19 the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near bankfull conditions with a maximum value of 7.8 feet Sunday morning. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Plateau Creek Cameo 8.0 5.6 Fri 3 pm MDT 7.0 7.8 7.6 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
